title: Mondor’s Disease after Aesthetic Breast Surgery: A Case Series and Literature Review
patient: A 38-year-old woman was admitted to obtain a bilateral retroglandular silicone breast implant via inframammary fold. The postoperative period was uneventful until the 3rd week. The patient observed a fibrous cord below the right breast without any other symptoms. The clinical diagnosis was thrombophlebitis of the subcutaneous vein as a symptom of Mondor’s disease. The cord-like lesions disappeared 2 weeks later without any treatment [].
